com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl

Class RenderAction<T extends RenderParams>

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameworkResourceIdProvider
      • com.android.layoutlib.bridge.impl.RenderAction<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the RenderParams implementation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RenderDrawable, RenderSessionImpl

    public abstract class RenderAction<T extends RenderParams>
extends FrameworkResourceIdProvider
    Base class for rendering action. It provides life-cycle methods to init and stop the rendering. The most important methods are: init(long) and acquire(long) to start a rendering and release() after the rendering.

      protected RenderAction(T params)
      Creates a renderAction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderAction

        protected RenderAction(T params)
        Creates a renderAction.

        This must be followed by a call to RenderAction#init(), which act as a call to acquire(long)

        Parameters:
        params - the RenderParams. This must be a copy that the action can keep

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public Result init(long timeout)
        Initializes and acquires the scene, creating various Android objects such as context, inflater, and parser.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the time to wait if another rendering is happening.
        Returns:
        whether the scene was prepared
        See Also:
        acquire(long), release()

      • acquire

        public Result acquire(long timeout)
        Prepares the scene for action.

        This call is blocking if another rendering/inflating is currently happening, and will return whether the preparation worked. The preparation can fail if another rendering took too long and the timeout was elapsed. More than one call to this from the same thread will have no effect and will return Result#SUCCESS. After scene actions have taken place, only one call to release() must be done.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the time to wait if another rendering is happening.
        Returns:
        whether the scene was prepared
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(long) was never called.
        See Also:
        release()

      • release

        public void release()
        Cleans up the scene after an action.

      • getLog

        public LayoutLog getLog()
        Returns the log associated with the session.
        Returns:
        the log or null if there are none.

      • checkLock

        protected void checkLock()
        Checks that the lock is owned by the current thread and that the current context is the one from this scene.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current context is different than the one owned by the scene, or if acquire(long) was not called.

      • getId

        public java.lang.Integer getId(ResourceType resType,
                               java.lang.String resName)
